title.narrative: COMMUNICATION FOR DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: By the end of 2021, communities, consisting of families/ caregivers, men, women, children and adolescents adopt positive behavioral that contribute to the child survival, protection and development throughout the country., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 6:The country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards within the priorities for affected populations in achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2021, communities, consisting of families/ caregivers, men, women, children and adolescents adopt positive behavioralthat contribute to the child survival, protection and development throughout the country.

description.narrative: A strategy was developed, and 876 community platforms were established during 2021, to encourage adoption of the 8 essential family practice. Strategy implementation was enhanced through technical assistance and capacity development provided to MOH and partners to strengthen their Systems. The national communication for Development taskforce, partner and community influencers enhanced Advocacy and Coordination for implementation. This holistic approach, enhanced UNICEF’s ability and position to promote positive behaviour and practices at community and individual levels. Traditional and innovative tools for evidence-generation and community engagement were adopted to enhance engagement and monitoring of community behaviors | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:18/01/2022
